course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Municipal Hydrosystems Engineering and Management
course.description: The course integrates the knowledge of hydrology, hydraulics, statistics, economics, and optimization in the dealing with municipal hydrosystems engineering and management. In particular, focuses will be given to quantity aspect of water supplies and water excesses. The hydrosystems to be covered include water distribution, urban sewage and stormwater drainage, reservoirs/detention facilities, pumps, etc.
course.prerequisites: CIVL 2160 and CIVL 3520 and CIVL 3530 and IELM 3020

reviews.author: SKK
reviews.comment_content:
Revision of hydraulic, eg open channel flow, gradually varied flow, pump, pipe flow, head loss, minor loss
hydrology: runoff, rainfall intensity...
design of drainage system: Manhole, design pipe diameter
design of sewerage discharge: discharge in river, diffusion, sea current
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explained the concepts very clear. He helped us review and consolidate all hydraulic concepts we learned in 3510.
reviews.comment_grading:
good grading
the class size is quite small but the grading is still good
reviews.comment_workload:
Average Work load
three homework, the TAs will explain and teach us how to do the hw during the tutorial
one literature review project
